net.letscode.game.api.zone

Class Zone

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.letscode.game.api.zone.Zone
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JsonSerializable, TargetedSerializable<Entity>, EventBusProvider
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChatZone, Zone2D

    public class Zone
extends Object
implements TargetedSerializable<Entity>, EventBusProvider
    A zone is an abstract collection of entities.

    Zones can be extended to provide additional functionality; see the additional classes within this package for examples.

    In addition to

    Author:
    timothyb89

    • Field Detail

      • bus

        protected EventBus bus
        The EventBus for this Zone. This should be used to push new events to registered listener classes. Note that all event types will need to be registered with the EventBus; this may be done by subclasses by calling EventBus.add(Class).

      • entities

        protected List<Entity> entities
        The list of entities contained in this zone. Note that this does not include entities within child zones. TODO: possibly use something like a LinkedHashSet here to speed up calls to contains(). Iteration would remain O(n) but contains() would be O(1) for a nicely-dispersed list.

        public Zone()

    • Method Detail

      • bus

        public EventBusClient bus()
        Description copied from interface: EventBusProvider
        Gets the EventBusClient for this ClientSession, which allows other classes to register themselves to receive event notifications.
        Specified by:
        bus in interface EventBusProvider
        Returns:
        the EventBusClient for this class

      • addEntity

        public void addEntity(Entity entity)
        Adds the given entity to this zone. This will fire a ZoneEnteredEvent which may be extended by subclasses to provide additional information. Note that as an entity may join multiple zones at a time, this will not have a direct affect on any other zones the entity may happen to be a member of.

        Note that all zone addition and removal logic resides in this class; any methods that may exist in Entity or World are essentially wrappers around this method unless other functionality is otherwise noted.

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to add to the zone
        See Also:
        removeEntity(Entity), fireZoneEnteredEvent(Entity)

      • removeEntity

        public void removeEntity(Entity entity)
        Removes the given entity from this zone. This will fire a ZoneExitedEvent, though it may be extended by subclasses to provide additional information.

        Note that all zone addition and removal logic resides in this class; any methods that may exist in Entity or World are essentially wrappers around this method unless other functionality is otherwise noted.

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to remove from the zone
        See Also:
        addEntity(Entity), fireZoneExitedEvent(Entity)

      • fireZoneEnteredEvent

        protected void fireZoneEnteredEvent(Entity entity)
        This fires a ZoneEnteredEvent. This may be overridden by subclasses should they wish to modify the event or event parameters.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity that entered the zone
        See Also:
        addEntity(Entity)

      • fireZoneExitedEvent

        protected void fireZoneExitedEvent(Entity entity)
        This fires a ZoneExitedEvent, and is called by removeEntity(Entity) when an entity is removed from the zone. This may be overridden by subclasses should they wish to modify the event or event parameters.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity removed from the zone

      • containsEntity

        public boolean containsEntity(Entity entity)
        Checks if this zone contains the given entity. Note that this does not check child zones for the entity.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to check for
        Returns:
        true if the zone contains the given entity; false if not

      • serializeEntities

        protected void serializeEntities(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator g,
                     Entity target)
                          throws IOException
        Serializes the list of entities for this zone into a JSON array. Note that this simply produces a field value and not an actual field, and is suitable for callers to use as a field value after calling JsonGenerator.writeFieldName(String).
        Parameters:
        g - the JsonGenerator to use
        Throws:
        IOException

      • serialize

        public void serialize(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator g)
               throws IOException
        Serializes the entire zone; that is, all entities within the zone. Subclasses may wish to override this method to add additional fields.
        Specified by:
        serialize in interface JsonSerializable
        Parameters:
        g - the JsonGenerator to write the zone data to.
        Throws:
        IOException
